text:

options.A: People are not ruled by the leaders they want
options.B: People are not concerned about who rules them
options.C: The rulers are not concerned about the people

click here

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
The witness said he had no axe to grind with his brothers?

options.A: He had no hatred for the brothers
options.B: He had no axe and therefore stole the matchet
options.C: He had no axe and therefore borrowed their matchet
options.D: He had no vested interest in the brothers.

explanation:
To not have a grievance with someone

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
The footballers moved with their tails between their legs?

options.A: They moved happily because they won the match
options.B: They were unhappy because they had been despised by their opponents
options.C: They were ashamed because they had been defeated
options.D: They moved with their tails between their legs

explanation:
feeling ashamed, embarrassed or unhappy because you have been defeated or punished

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
The headmaster managed to talk his way out of having to give a speech.

options.A: He delieverd a speech despite the difficulty
options.B: He managed to give a speech out of a difficult situation
options.C: He managed to get himself out of a difficult situation
options.D: He managed to talk on his way

explanation:
He manoeuvred his way and ended up not giving a speech.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
As regards the matter, we have crossed the rubicon

you mean that they have reached a point of no return. final decision

text:

Uche is full of himself?
explanation:
This means Uche is proud. conceited means excessively proud of oneself.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.
As debutants in that tournament, the super eagles were up against their first opponents by three goals to nil?

options.A: The Super Eagles were playing in the tournament for the first time, but they won their match by three goals to nothing
options.B: Though the Super Eagles were rated as the weakest side in the tournament, they won their first match by three goals to nil
options.C: Even though the Super Eagles were playing without some of their stars, they won their match by three goals to nil
options.D: As the best trackers inthe match, the Super Eagles easily defeated their opponents by three goals to nothing

explanation:
The super eagles were leading by 3 goals.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

The woman was mournful as her husband was found dead drunk?

options.A: She was sad because her husband was absolutely drunk
options.B: She was apprehensive that her husband would drink as soon as he recovered fromdrunken stupor
options.C: She was sad because her husband was drunk and always as helpless as a dead man
options.D: She was mourning because her husband drank and died

explanation:
The woman was moved to tears as she saw her husband drunk to stupor
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:

I am optimistic about the interview though it was a mind-bending exercise?
explanation:
If you describe something as mind-bending , you mean that it is difficult to understand

text:

The trader was amused by the cut-throat rush for the goods?
explanation:
cut-throat;fierce and intense; involving the use of ruthless measures.
Lacklustre; lacking in vitality, force, or conviction

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The teacher said that Ali's essay was full of many redundant details?
explanation:
The correct answer isC. necessary.Redundantmeans "unnecessary" or "superfluous." It describes details or information that is repetitive or not needed. The opposite of "redundant" would benecessaryor essential.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:

His father surmounted the myriad of obstacles on his way?

myriad; a countless or extremely great number of people or things.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

Her ingenuous smile drew our attention?
explanation:
ingenuous means; innocent and unsuspecting.
Theoppositeofingenuousfrom the above options isarrogantwhich means having or revealing an exaggerated sense of one's own importance or abilities.

text:

Ndeni gave a flawless speech at the party?
explanation:
flawless; without any imperfections or defects; perfect.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

Beneath Ado's gruff exterior, he's really very kind-hearted?
explanation:
In this context gruff (relative to a voice) means, low and harsh.
Opposite is gentle.

text:

Governing a country is not always as straightforward as people sometimes imagine?

straightforward; uncomplicated and easy to do or understand.

text:

The captain says sport is being debased by commercial sponsorship?

Debased; reduced in quality or value.

text:

Aisha seems to feel ambivalent about her future?
explanation:
Ambivalent; having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something or someone.
Being decisive means that you have the ability to decide

text:

The crowd was very receptive to the speaker's suggestion?
explanation:
Receptive; willing to consider or accept new suggestions and ideas.

The report of the committee contained a plethora of details?

The weather was still very heavy and sultry?

text:

A political impasses does not offer the best opportunity for merrymaking?
explanation:
Impasses; a situation in which no progress is possible, especially because of disagreement.
Gridlock; a situation, typically one involving opposing parties, in which no progress can be made.

text:

Ada gave her husband a look that made words superfluous?

scanty:small or insufficient in quantity or amount.

We were all enthusiastic as we awaited the result of the election?

Elated; being so extremely proud and overjoyed

The uniform makes the guards look absurd?

text:

Kaltume crouched over the papers on her desk?

crouched; a position where the knees are bent and the upper body is brought forward and down, typically in order to avoid detection or to defend oneself.

text:

melange; a mixture, or a group of different things or people

text:

Her reputation is without a blemish?

Rattle off;To say or recite something very quickly, without much thought or consideration.

text:

options.A: if i had come some days before
options.B: if I had come the day before

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

The boy told his mother...... ?

options.A: that was the girl he told her  about
options.B: that was the girl I told you about her
options.C: that was the girl I told her about
options.D: that is the girl he told her about

explanation:
The boy told his mother,that was the girl he told her about
The simple ruleisthat "is"ispresent tenseand"was"ispast tense. If it's happening now, you use "is". If it happened in the past, you use "was".
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

His wife was badly injured in the fracas, but I think she will pull ....... ?
explanation:
His wife was badly injured in the fracas, but I think she will pullthrough
You pull through when yoy get through an illness or other dangerous or difficult situation.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

A wide range of options ....... made available to students in their final year last year?
explanation:
A wide range of optionsweremade available to students in their final year last year?
The common rule that determines how you use “was” and “were” is that singular and pluralrule. If the noun is singular, you use was. If the noun is plural, you usewere.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

One of the women who ...... in the premises ...... been ordered to quit?
explanation:
Has is used alongside the PRONOUNS He / She / It and Who and SINGULAR NOUNS.
We use ''sell'' because the sentence refers to a single  person in its present tense

Long after everyone ....... the hall, Obi still sat inside?

text:

When we looked up, we ...... the plane some miles away?

When we looked up, wesightedthe plane some miles away?
sighted; (of a person) having the ability to see; not blind.

text:

They are the ...... dresses.
explanation:
They are thebabies'sdresses?

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

Vital ...... is still spread ..... word of mouth in most villages in Africa?

Vitalinformationis still spreadbyword of mouth in most villages in Africa?
By; is mostly used when referring to a means of something,

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

Western education is one of the ...... colonial rule.
explanation:
Colonial rule refers to the period when Western powers governed and controlled various territories around the world. The term "legacies" in this context refers to the lasting impact, influence, or effects that Western education left behind during the colonial period. It implies that the education system introduced by the colonial powers has had a significant and enduring influence on the societies that experienced colonial rule.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

The man was happy that his son confessed his guilt and so the others were .......?
explanation:
The man was happy that his son confessed his guilt and so the others wereexonerated
Exonerated;  absolve or clear (someone) from blame for a fault or wrongdoing.

text:

The federal Government has ....... child trafficking?
explanation:
The federal Government hasproscribedchild trafficking?
proscribed; forbid, especially by law. Denounce or condemn

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

Based on the facts before me, I have no alternative ....... to hold you responsible?
explanation:
Based on the facts before me, I have no alternativebutto hold you responsible?
But; is used to indicate the impossibility of anything other than what is being stated.

text:
Choose the option that best completes the gap(s).

Many people would always find reasons to ....... the law?
explanation:
Many people would always find reasons tocircumventthe law?
circumvent; to avoid, overcome or to find a way around something such as a law or rule etc, often in a clever way.

text:
Choose the most appropriate stress pattern from the options. The stressed syllable are written in capital letters(s).

political
explanation:
For words ending with ''ical'' the primary stress is placed on the syllable immediately before “-ic-.
po-LIT-i-cal
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the most appropriate stress pattern from the options. The stressed syllable are written in capital letters(s).

satisfactory?
explanation:
In pronouncing the word satisfactory, the third syllable is more pronounced than the rest. Hence we have
sa-tis-FAC-to-ry

captivity?

text:
The word in capital letters has the emphatic stress. Choose the option to which the given relates.

EMEKA finished his home work yesterday.

options.A: Was Emeka helped to do his home work?
options.B: Did Emeka do his home work yesterday?
options.C: When did Emeka finish his home work?
options.D: Who finished his home work yesterday?

explanation:
In responding to questions on emphatic stress, Interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. This means that, the statement that does not have the emphasized word in it is the correct answer.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The word in capital letters has the emphatic stress. Choose the option to which the given sentence relates.

Taiwo SAILED to London.
explanation:
In responding to questions on emphatic stress in examinations, interrogative sentences will be provided as options. The interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. ''sailed'' is the emphasized word here. ''fly'' in option A contradicts the emphasized word
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The word in capital letters has the emphatic stress. Choose the option to which the given sentence relates.

My bag is made of LEATHER?

options.A: Whose bag is made of leather?
options.B: Is my bag made of polythene?
options.D: Is my bag made of leather?

explanation:
In responding to questions on emphatic stress in examinations, interrogative sentences will be provided as options. The interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. LEATHER is the emphasized word here. ''polythene'' in option B contradicts the emphasized word
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
